title: Scenic, ca. 1830
medium: Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper
provenance: Was hung in the Tower House in Waterville, New York, in 1830. Moved to Munson-Williams-Proctor in the 1950s. Sold to the Cooper-hewitt in 2000.
dimensions: H x W: 221 x 1440.2 cm (7 ft. 3 in. x 47 ft. 3 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, Pauline Cooper Noyes, and General Acquisitions Endowment Funds
description: Includes the Bay of Naples, an erupting Mount Vesuvius, tall ships in the harbor, and many figures attending to business and pleasure. 27 panels plus fragments of panels. Printed in a monochrome yellow ocher colorway, possibly called biche chamois.

exhibitions.title: Rooms with a View: Landscape & Wallpaper

tombstone.epitaph:
Scenic, ca. 1830.
ca. 1830. Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper. Museum purchase from Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, Pauline Cooper Noyes, and General Acquisitions Endowment Funds. 2000-29-1-a/mm.
